candidates.name: Crichton Christie
candidates.why_elect: I can be the voice of reason on Council. I have good ideas, am always thinking and can listen to people. I have a wealth of knowledge and experience and have a willingness to research and speak out on important issues.
candidates.why_stand: I want to continue to contribute to a better Whangarei. I love working for the people of Whangarei and I still have more to contribute.

candidates.name: Tricia Cutforth
candidates.why_elect: I have a good understanding of all parts of the district: rural, urban, retail, industry, community... I've owned businesses, worked in factories, been Northland manager of a govt department, worked for councils. I have an MA in Sociology and a Master of Public Management. I'm effective—I get things done.
candidates.why_stand: I'm Whangarei born and bred; I love this district and am strongly focused on 'putting locals first'; if it works for locals, visitors will love it too. I want Whangarei to be recognised as a progressive district that is actively involved in improving the wellbeing of all its citizens.

candidates.name: Shaquille Shortland
candidates.why_elect: I am dedicated to the people. I bring with me a wealth of knowledge and experience in Te Ao Māori, Governance and Entrepreneurship on all levels, Public sector mechanics, Education, Culture and Arts and Youth Development. I also maintain a vast network of connections locally, nationally and globally.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council to bring diversity in thought and action. I am a young Māori Catholic Male born and bred in Otangarei, Whangarei. I want to advocate for the three biggest groups of the country that do not vote in elections; Māori, Youth and Migrants.
